post.summary: Create a new logging by unique name
post.description: event is related to high level functionality of device.

get.description: event is related to high level functionality of device.

patch.description: event is related to high level functionality of device.

delete.description: event is related to high level functionality of device.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

profile.description: event is related to high level functionality of device.

priority-description.description:
A text string associated with the values of facility, severity, and
system-module.

running-config-change.description:
Notification about changes in running configuration will
be sent to the syslog server(s).

transmission-interval.description: Egress rate limit for sending notifications.

x-enumDescriptions.IP_ADDRESS: IP address of the outgoing interface as the origin-id.
x-enumDescriptions.HOSTNAME: Hostname of the device as the origin-id.
x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Disable origin-id in the Syslog message.

origin-id.x-typeDescription: Specify the origin information for the syslog message.
origin-id.description: Origin Id for the syslog message.

prefix.description: Add a string to the message content. The string may contain upto 48 US ASCII printable characters except for space.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

priority-description.description:
A text string associated with the values of facility, severity, and
system-module.

running-config-change.description:
Notification about changes in running configuration will
be sent to the syslog server(s).

transmission-interval.description: Egress rate limit for sending notifications.

x-enumDescriptions.IP_ADDRESS: IP address of the outgoing interface as the origin-id.
x-enumDescriptions.HOSTNAME: Hostname of the device as the origin-id.
x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Disable origin-id in the Syslog message.

origin-id.x-typeDescription: Specify the origin information for the syslog message.
origin-id.description: Origin Id for the syslog message.

prefix.description: Add a string to the message content. The string may contain upto 48 US ASCII printable characters except for space.

module.description: List of module type, module and sub-module.

type-process-subcategory.description:
key for module. This key is the combination of type, process and subcategory separated by ~
type        - Logging type.
process     - Name of the debug process.
subcategory - Name of the debug subcategory type.

severity.x-typeDescription: Logging level upto which, the messages are logged.

trace.description: trace value for debugging specific user or AP

client.description: Client name to filter debug logs

column.description: Column name to filter debug logs

table.description: Table name to filter debug logs

entities-severity.x-typeDescription: Logging level upto which, the messages are logged.
entities-severity.description: Minimum log severity to filter debug logs

vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
vlan-id.description: VLAN entity and its corresponding value of this sub-module.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

port.description: Port entity and its corresponding value of this sub-module.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

ip.description:
IPv4 or IPv6 entity and its corresponding value of this
sub-module.

mac.description: MAC entity and its corresponding value of this sub-module.

instance.description: Instance entity and its corresponding value of this sub-module.

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf.description: VRF entity and its corresponding value of this sub-module.

ubt-zone.description: UBT Zone entity and its corresponding value of this sub-module.

logging-syslog-enable.description: Enable this for non default vrf

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

host.description:
FQDN or host name or IPv4 address or IPv6 address of the syslog server.
For AP devices, support IPv4 address or IPv6 address and up to 3 syslog servers for an AP.
For GW devices, host contains IP address and logging type separated by ~.
logging type includes: AP_DEBUG, NETWORK, SECURITY, SYSTEM, USER, USER_DEBUG, WIRELESS, case sensitive.

filter-name.description: Name of the filter used to filter syslog messages.

transport.x-typeDescription: Transport layer protocol used to forward messages to the server.
transport.description: Transport layer protocol used to forward messages to the server.

port-number.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
port-number.description: Port number of the syslog server.

severity.x-typeDescription: Logging level upto which, the messages are logged.
severity.description:
Syslog message severity. Only messages with severity higher than
or equal to the specified value will be sent to the remote server.

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf.description:
VRF of the remote_host.
If not specified, remote-host will be routed through default VRF.

include-auditable-events.description:
Specifies whether auditable events (audit and authentication)
should be transmitted to the remote syslog server.

x-enumDescriptions.SUBJECT_NAME: certificate and subject name based authentication.

tls-auth-mode.x-typeDescription: TLS authentication mode used to authenticate the server.
tls-auth-mode.description: TLS authentication mode used to authenticate the server

disable.description: Disable sending syslog messages to the remote syslog server.

unsecure-tls-renegotiation.description:
Enable TLS session with syslog server which does not support secure
renegotiation.

rate-limit.description: Rate limiting applied to messages sent to the remote syslog server.

burst.description: Maximum number of logs allowed in a given rate limit interval.

mgmt.description: Syslog server for logs reachable through mgmt interface

control-description.description: A text string associated with the given IP address.

host-filter.description: filter associated with the given IP address.

smm.description:
syslog server should receive log messages from a standby management
module.

source-interface.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
source-interface.description: Source address of outgoing Syslog messages, only support IPv4. Must match an existing VLAN interface ID.

tls.description: Enable TLS option for rsyslog, only support IPv4

local-facility.x-typeDescription: Facility to use when logging to Remote Syslog Server.

sequence-number.description:
Filter criteria sequence number. (Default: Increments by 10 from
the largest sequence-id currently used in this filter.)

event-id-range.description: Event id or range of event ids.

x-enumDescriptions.HIGHER_OR_EQUAL_TO: Severity type higher than or equal to.
x-enumDescriptions.LESSER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: Severity type lesser than or equal to.

match-severity-key.description: Type of matching severity for logging filter.

match-severity-value.x-typeDescription: Logging level upto which, the messages are logged.

enable.description: Specifies whether filter feature is enabled.

action.x-typeDescription: Action applied on the selected events.
action.description: Action applied on the selected events.

default-action.x-typeDescription: Action applied on the selected events.

lf-name.description: Filter used to filter the message.

enable.description: Specifies whether looging filter feature is enabled.
Specifies whether filter feature is enabled.

event-list.description: Action applied on the event list

severity.x-typeDescription: Logging level upto which, the messages are logged.
severity.description:
Syslog message severity. Only messages with severity higher than
or equal to the specified value will be sent to the remote server.

event-action.x-typeDescription: Action applied on the selected events.

ArubaLogging_Logger.description:
Generated log messages may be directed to various destinations including
console, files, remote syslog servers to send messages to the log

enable.description: Display the live logs on console.

log-type.x-typeDescription: Specifies the type of log notification.

min-severity.x-typeDescription: Logging level upto which, the messages are logged.

filter-regex.description:
POSIX regular expression filter associated
with console-logging.

maxsize.description: Log size (in megabytes), which would trigger rotation.

period.description: The user configured period of logrotation.

target.description:
The user configured URI of the remote host.
If not specified log files will be rotated
locally.

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf.description:
VRF for logrotate remote host connections.
If not set, then the 'default' VRF will be used.

severity.x-typeDescription: Logging level upto which, the messages are logged.
severity.description:
Minimum severity for logging.
For AP devices, Range: EMERGENCY, ALERT, CRITICAL, ERROR, WARNING, NOTICE, INFO, DEBUG.
For PVOS devices, Range: MAJOR, INFO, WARNING, DEBUG, ERROR.

facility.x-typeDescription: Facility to use when logging to Remote Syslog Server.
facility.description: Syslog facility to be used for remote syslog messages.

accounting-format-native.description:
Enable sending audit log messages to the syslog server in Linux format.
If it is not enabled, then it sends in ArubaOS-CX defined log format.

event-trap.description: This command enables/disables the notification of the events to be sent as traps.

notification-threshold.description:
Threshold percentage relative to the size of the
log buffer. Once the utilization has reached this threshold, a
log notification will be generated.

event-log.description: Configure the logging threshold for event log buffer.

auth-log.description: Configure the logging threshold for auth log buffer.

audit-log.description: Configure the logging threshold for audit log buffer.

security-log.description: Configure the logging threshold for security log buffer.

commands-log.description: Configure the logging threshold for commands log buffer.

https-server-log.description: Configure the logging threshold for http-server log buffer.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.
